title: Arrest made in shooting death of Lexington teenager
content:
LEXINGTON, Ky. (WKYT) - An arrest has been made in the murder of a Lexington teenager.
A 16-year-old male has been charged in the shooting death of 15-year-old Robert Durrum. The 16-year-old has not been identified because he's a juvenile. He's charged with murder, robbery, and tampering with physical evidence.
Lexington police say Durrum was found in the road on Belmont Drive near Preakness Drive around 11:30 p.m. Wednesday. According to the coroner, Durrum died from his injuries at University of Kentucky Medical Center shortly after midnight.
Police say Durrum was shot at least once in the abdomen.
Police say Durrum knew the suspect. According to police, Durrum and the 16-year-old had an altercation after meeting, leading to the shooting.
